page.title: 02Recent history of Pitney
page.content: Before the First World War,Pitney was invisible from the main road.The area was a dense forest.During the 1914-18 war,the trees were cut down for use in the trenches but even during the Thirties,there was a dense forest still to be seen.More trees were cut down for the Second World War and the Dutch Elm Disease finally destroyed the trees.The main industry was farming,tiny farms,some only of 40 acres.It's still a working village, the farms still only employ father and son to work them.There were a few council houses built before the war but they have now been sold off.Unfortunately,the new houses are all in the Â£50,000 class and young people cannot afford them.The population is old and getting older.It will eventually become a place where people retire to die.
